thread.title: UNM provost calls scorecard of students' salaries unfair
thread.title_full: UNM provost calls scorecard of students' salaries unfair

title: UNM provost calls scorecard of students' salaries unfair
text:
UNM provost calls scorecard of students’ salaries unfair By -   
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) - A top University of New Mexico official says a federal scorecard that says the school’s graduates earn thousands of dollars less than their peers from other colleges is unfair. 
The Albuquerque Journal reported (http://bit.ly/1j8B7QO) Sunday that Provost Chaouki Abdallah is criticizing the U.S. Department of Education’s College Scorecard. 
According to the study, UNM students who enrolled and obtained financial aid make $5,000 less than the national median for students. 
The scorecard says the median salary for the typical four-year college student 10 years after they first registered was $40,500. 
UNM’s median student earning was $35,900. 
Abdullah says the findings are off because they include salaries of students at satellite campuses, which are two-year programs in rural areas. 
The scorecard calculates median salaries for students from more than 7,000 campuses. 
___ 
Information from: Albuquerque Journal, http://www.abqjournal.com
